metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000613 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Legion of the Bouncy Castle Legion of the Bouncy Castle Java Cryptography APIs 1.58 up to but not including 1.60 contains a CWE-470: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection') vulnerability in XMSS/XMSS^MT private key deserialization that can result in Deserializing an XMSS/XMSS^MT private key can result in the execution of unexpected code. This attack appear to be exploitable via A handcrafted private key can include references to unexpected classes which will be picked up from the class path for the executing application. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 1.60 and later.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000613` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbcmail-java - 1.60-1
libbcpg-java - 1.60-1
libbcpkix-java - 1.60-1
libbcprov-java - 1.60-1
libbctls-java - 1.60-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: debian> (XMSS/XMSS^MT algorithms were first introduced in BC >= 1.57)

criterions.comment: bouncycastle package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.60-1').
